result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody J. Utgard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation.
Concurrent with: Counts 1 and 2 in 14CF138

miscConds.notes: Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.
May not possess/use firearms or body armor.

May not vote until civil rights are restored.
May not hold elected office.
If not a US citizen may face deportation or potential loss of other civil rights.
Absolute Sobriety.

Compas and follow recommendations.
Participate/complete requited programs of Probation.

supervisions.notes:
Subject to Good Time & Work Release.
203 days sentence credit = TIME SERVED.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
